channel.title: Thoughts on Current rsps bases
channel.description:
So recently ive been comparing the code to many different sources that are currently out there. I keep asking myself [b]What is the best/Stable source?[/b] Some people say [b]Hyperion[/b] is the best while others say [b]RuneSource[/b] is the best. Now I know alot of people that prefer using [b]Shards[/b]. So I am asking the community What they think the best source is.
In my opinion I would go with Runesource or Hyperion. Mainly because Graham Designed Hyperion and i got to know him as a friend not just as a programmer. Then I would probably do Runesource because again I have discussed many things with blake before and we grew a friendship before he deleted all his accounts on the communities.
So take the time now and comment below on your personal Opinion on the mentioned sources or name another one that was not mentioned.

item.title: Thoughts on Current rsps bases
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

[quote=“enzo42, post:23, topic:520678”][quote author=hadlich4 link=topic=639177.msg4308500#msg4308500 date=1370329944]

hyperion is not complicated at all

I tried using pi, I don’t know if its to the point where its so messed up i cant even add content, its unorganized, and sloppy, so much easier to do things in hyperion, e.g making bosses (REAL bosses not keep hitting till you kill then phat drop) with actual attacks, variations, etc.

in pi i cant do any custom content

I can, the project i am currently working on is a PI im taking out all jagexs armours except the basics bronze-rune and making my own thats boss armours and all, then we are also taking out all the bosses and making new more unique ones, then we are gunna have new dungeons and such, this is all with the help of amy_webb, poopler, our webdeveloper nic and myself. theres lots more as well, all new minigames, thats just the beginning, so yes there is lots you can do still, and yea your right it is a bit sloppy but atleast its easy access, and idk about unorgranized, i find it very easy to find everything throughout my source
[/quote]

Seriously can you please stop trying to advertise your server in every post you make? Everytime you start about your server and how great it is, shut up please.[/quote]

i totally agree, but jagex has improved within the past few months with the new content as in changing the look of all the basic models to make them all unique, but yea all the jagex computer science people and all are older and have lost their creativeness so they are losing that since of adventure thats the biggest reason why i quit runescape because i feel like the adventure was gone, and i feel they are slowing moving towards not caring about the players but just the players money (soloman store thing). but i cant blame em they have to make money some how, although they make a shit load from memberships.

where in that do i make a single reference to my server development?

Personal choice man. You may say Hyperion is complicated. I say no as I can develop things on Hyperion 10x faster than on PI. And I used to be a PI noob!

yea thats true, i dont got much experience with hyperion but just upon first glance it confused me, but yea its based on opinion what ever your more comfortable with

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts on Current rsps bases
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“hadlich4, post:12, topic:520678”][quote author=drubrkletern link=topic=639177.msg4308329#msg4308329 date=1370307569]
Anything but project insanity
[/quote]

I know most people say pi’s are shit but they are so simple and there is so many tutorials (for new people who need help) and things you can do with them. yea sure they aren’t the best but the uniqueness that you can add into them is what i like. as for hyperion and so on its just so complicated i’d rather just say screw it and go with the simple stuff and its good for learning basic things.[/quote]
Personal choice man. You may say Hyperion is complicated. I say no as I can develop things on Hyperion 10x faster than on PI. And I used to be a PI noob!

Read full topic

hyperion is not complicated at all

I tried using pi, I don’t know if its to the point where its so messed up i cant even add content, its unorganized, and sloppy, so much easier to do things in hyperion, e.g making bosses (REAL bosses not keep hitting till you kill then phat drop) with actual attacks, variations, etc.

in pi i cant do any custom content

I can, the project i am currently working on is a PI im taking out all jagexs armours except the basics bronze-rune and making my own thats boss armours and all, then we are also taking out all the bosses and making new more unique ones, then we are gunna have new dungeons and such, this is all with the help of amy_webb, poopler, our webdeveloper nic and myself. theres lots more as well, all new minigames, thats just the beginning, so yes there is lots you can do still, and yea your right it is a bit sloppy but atleast its easy access, and idk about unorgranized, i find it very easy to find everything throughout my source
[/quote]I really think as a bunch of uneducated (tertiary-wise) teenagers you will produce content that is way better than Jagex’s stupid computer science majors’ and software engineers’. I can’t way to play!

i totally agree, but jagex has improved within the past few months with the new content as in changing the look of all the basic models to make them all unique, but yea all the jagex computer science people and all are older and have lost their creativeness so they are losing that since of adventure thats the biggest reason why i quit runescape because i feel like the adventure was gone, and i feel they are slowing moving towards not caring about the players but just the players money (soloman store thing). but i cant blame em they have to make money some how, although they make a shit load from memberships.[/quote]

item.title: Thoughts on Current rsps bases
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:9, topic:520678”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=639177.msg4308395#msg4308395 date=1370315934]

Apollo is the most scaleable and RuneSource is the fastest (especially modified to utilise all the cores of the processor to handle updating). If you can write your own base though, I’d recommend it. Though your framework may not be as powerful as Apollo or fast as RuneSource, the learning experience will give you the ability to build upon your base more efficiently and faster than any others.

Not to mention that you know the ins and outs of your source.
[/quote]That’s what I meant by ‘the ability to build upon your base more efficiently and faster’.[/quote]Oh soz, didn’t read that.

sinisoul:

They all have strengths and weaknesses but none really shine out to me as being the best or perfect in any degree.

I agree. I see some things to do easier and harder in different bases.

Some things are overly-complicated (i.e. winterlove’s way of loading and saving players) and some things are pretty simple (i.e. navigating through Hyperion’s files). But Hyperion really wins my cookie. It has the least faults and more strengths imo.

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts on Current rsps bases
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:5, topic:520678”][quote author=drubrkletern link=topic=639177.msg4308329#msg4308329 date=1370307569]
Anything but project insanity
[/quote]ANYTHING can be made stable even though true I wouldn’t want to have to rewrite that :s

[hr]

I would say apollo even though friends have said before there is no current “base” as of yet that is stable after content is added.[/quote]
Apollo, Hyperion, Runesource, RS2HD, my favorite bases. Hyperion and RS2HD are my completely most favorite (they both really have the same design in terms of packaging use and file names/use, so they are really the same).
